1033928273191829504.text: A system can be more evil than the sum of the evil of its human parts. If you don’t account for emergent evil, you’ll end up with a useless morality where you can’t distinguish between people within human range of good/evil at all. It’s like adding a big constant to your y-axis.

1024742193716580352.text: This is your reminder to use something other than SMS for 2FA. The best method is to use a yubikey, and the second best way is to use an authenticator app. Stay safe out there. <3https://twitter.com/2sec4u/status/1024709051073134592 …

1021532826326298624.text: These problems are easy to overcome with proper smart contract design, so we shouldn't rely on them to prevent a dystopian murder future. Eventually a specialized assassination market will arise, and we need to figure out how we'll deal with that.

1021532204688531457.text: And by markets I mean contracts. Also note that these contracts are not well set up to incentivize assassination. If an assassin were to make a "yes" bet that someone would die, others could pile on and dilute the assassin's payout.

1021525517097287680.text: These assassination markets will likely fail. Augur has some mechanisms to prevent "unethical" contracts from being fulfilled. As a last resort, they could always shut down the system. But this is just proof of concept. There will be others...https://twitter.com/matt_odell/status/1021477596771561472 …
